channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- ansible
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- ansible

item.title: CVE-2016-8614|2024-08-06T02:27:41.024Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: A flaw was found in Ansible before version 2.2.0. The apt_key module does not properly verify key fingerprints, allowing remote adversary to create an OpenPGP key which matches the short key ID and inject this key instead of the correct key.

item.title: CVE-2016-8628|2024-08-06T02:27:40.971Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: Ansible before version 2.2.0 fails to properly sanitize fact variables sent from the Ansible controller. An attacker with the ability to create special variables on the controller could execute arbitrary commands on Ansible clients as the user Ansible runs as.

item.title: CVE-2016-8647|2024-08-06T02:27:41.291Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: An input validation vulnerability was found in Ansible's mysql_user module before 2.2.1.0, which may fail to correctly change a password in certain circumstances. Thus the previous password would still be active when it should have been changed.
